ISSUE.TITLE: podman exec leak ExecIds when command is not found
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description running podman exec with a non existing command leaks an execids on the container ``` podman inspect designate_worker | jq '.[].ExecIDs | length' 19105 ``` with a good enough number of execids, the bolt db can reach hundreds of MB in size and podman ps runs in dozens of seconds. This is seen on my set-up because an improper healtcheck command is configured, so there is 1 call per minute. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. podman run --name designate_worker --rm quay.io/centos/centos:stream9-minimal sleep 3600 2. podman exec -ti designate_worker /openstack/healthcheck 3. podman inspect designate_worker | jq '.[].ExecIDs | length' ### Describe the results you received 1 an execid is still present in db ### Describe the results you expected 0 all execid have been cleaned-up ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.32.0 cgroupControllers: -
